title: CSS Flexbox
subject: CSS
learning_objectives: Understand Flex Container vs Flex Item
theory:
The Flexible Box Layout Module (Flexbox) makes it easier to design flexible responsive layout structure without using float or positioning.

*   `display: flex`: Activates flexbox on the parent.
*   `flex-direction`: row, column, row-reverse, column-reverse.
*   `justify-content`: Aligns items horizontally (main axis).
*   `align-items`: Aligns items vertically (cross axis).

examples.output: The child element is perfectly centered horizontally and vertically.
examples.explanation: The holy grail of CSS layout, solved by Flexbox.

common_mistakes.correction: When `flex-direction: column`, the main axis rotates. `justify-content` now controls vertical alignment.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between `align-items` and `align-content`?
interview_questions.answer: `align-items` aligns items in a single line. `align-content` aligns lines in a multi-line flex container.

practice_problems.problem: Create a row of 3 items spread apart evenly.

real_world_use_cases.description: Flexbox is perfect for Navbars: Logo on far left, links in center, login button on far right.

summary: Flexbox changed web design forever. It is the primary tool for 1D layouts.
